data.title: Target drone systems
data.meta_description: Airbus offers a full range of target systems providing realistic and cost-effective training for ground-based and naval Air Defence and Air-to-Air Combat, encompassing towed aerial targets, direct aerial targets and surface targets.
data.text:
Airbus offers a full range of Target Systems providing realistic and cost-effective training for ground-based and naval Air Defence and Air-to-Air Combat, encompassing towed aerial Targets, direct aerial Targets and surface Targets.

With the expertise of more than 50 years of service for Armed Forces worldwide — involving over 3,500 missions performed and 2,300+ direct Targets deployed — Airbus has developed a set of proven support services that are tailorable to customers' specific needs and scenarios.

With its full-service solution, Airbus Defence and Space provides Aerial Target missions — delivered by Airbus personnel with AIRBUS hardware, equipment and Target drones. The service covers the main pillars of training

The unmanned expendable airborne platform

The capabilities of platform with the payload

The scenarios with the realistic threat replication ranging from single- to multi-platform missions based on the planning together with the customer.

This allows customers to focus entirely on their training.

The Target Systems & Services solutions allows customers to replicate the most challenging Air Defence scenarios — including air strikes, asymmetric threats, missile engagements, fighter a/c and split Target scenarios. Naval Surface Targets are complementing the portfolio e.g. replicating Fast Incoming Attack Crafts (FIAC).

Airbus' product line of fixed-wing aerial Targets has grown to encompass four different models, which are deployed from mobile pneumatic catapult launchers and can simulate the complete engagement process — from detection and classification to engagement decision and action. The portfolio undergoes continuous development and will grow its capabilities in the next years further to always offer the most realistic threat representation.

These platforms and the service provided by the AIRBUS personnel are certified operations by various airworthiness agencies.

The Do-DT25 is a medium-speed multi-purpose aerial Target that provides short-range infrared missile systems with an excellent Target to both track and engage for all Air Defence Scenarios.

The long list of operational payloads and its payload capacity adopts the platform to customer requirements.

To represent attack aircraft carrying a standoff ground attack weapon system, the Do-DT25 can be configured to carry and deploy a Do-DT55neo sub-Target, simulating an air-launched cruise missile.
